research_metadata.project: OXOT Energy Sector Neo4j Schema Extraction

Measurement.description: Energy measurement nodes tracking values across transmission systems

Device.description: Energy devices including EnergyDevice and distributed energy resources

Property.description: Energy properties tracking device characteristics and specifications

Asset.description: Physical energy assets including DERs, transmission lines, substations

Control.description: Control and management systems (EMS, NERC CIP compliance)

most_common_combinations.pattern_description: Primary pattern for transmission system measurements
Standard pattern for distribution devices with monitoring
Generation assets for distributed energy resources

label_distribution.4_labels: Typical for specialized assets (DER, TransmissionLine, Substation)
label_distribution.5_labels: Common for measurement and property nodes

Energy_Transmission.description: Transmission system nodes focusing on long-distance power delivery

Energy_Distribution.description: Distribution network nodes for local power delivery and control

Energy_Generation.description: Generation source nodes for renewable and distributed energy

VULNERABLE_TO.description: Security vulnerability relationships mapping attack surfaces

HAS_ENERGY_PROPERTY.description: Links devices to their energy-specific properties

CONTROLLED_BY_EMS.description: Links devices to Energy Management Systems

COMPLIES_WITH_NERC_CIP.description: Compliance relationships with NERC CIP standards

EXTENDS_SAREF_DEVICE.description: Extends SAREF (Smart Appliances REFerence) device ontology

CONNECTED_TO_GRID.description: Links distributed energy resources to power grid

relationship_statistics.relationship_density: High - extensive vulnerability mapping alongside functional relationships

hierarchical_organization.pattern: Multi-level labeling with ENERGY as root label
hierarchical_organization.evidence: All 35,475 nodes contain ENERGY label plus 3-5 additional labels
hierarchical_organization.benefit: Enables sector-wide queries while maintaining granular categorization

semantic_enrichment.pattern: Ontology extension through multiple label systems
semantic_enrichment.evidence: Nodes labeled with industry standards (SAREF, NERC CIP) alongside domain labels
semantic_enrichment.benefit: Standards compliance while maintaining domain-specific semantics

property_externalization.pattern: Properties separated from entities (6000 property nodes vs 10000 devices)
property_externalization.benefit: Flexible property management without entity modification

measurement_centralization.pattern: Centralized measurement nodes (18000) linked via GENERATES_MEASUREMENT
measurement_centralization.benefit: Time-series data and sensor integration at scale

control_system_integration.pattern: EMS and NERC CIP controls as separate entities
control_system_integration.evidence: 125 control nodes linked via CONTROLLED_BY_EMS and COMPLIES_WITH_NERC_CIP
control_system_integration.benefit: Regulatory compliance tracking and management system integration

vulnerability_tracking.evidence: 86.28% of all relationships are vulnerability mappings
vulnerability_tracking.benefit: Comprehensive security posture visibility for critical infrastructure

query_validation_results.notes: All queries executed successfully with consistent results. No data anomalies detected.

schema_summary.compliance_focus: NERC CIP standards with SAREF ontology extension
schema_summary.security_emphasis: High - vulnerability mapping dominant relationship type
schema_summary.recommended_optimization: Consider partitioning by subsector for query performance on large operations
